DOC.HEAD: $adv30
$adv31
For Release Weekend Editions Dec. 30-31
Eds: adds weekly price trends
UNDATED; ... belly stocks.''
DOC.TEXT: Here are some commodity price trends during the past week: Most grain and soybean futures retreated on the Chicago Board of Trade. Wheat for delivery in March settled Friday at $4.09\ a bushel down from $4.11} a week earlier; March corn edged up to $2.39} a bushel from $2.39; March oats slipped to $1.53{ a bushel from $1.54\; January soybeans dropped to $5.68 a bushel from $5.72\. Cattle futures rose slightly on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange while pork futures were mixed. December live cattle advanced for the fourth straight week, ending Friday at 77.37 cents a pound compared with 76.80 cents; January feeder cattle rose to 84.85 cents a pound from 84.82 cents; February hogs slipped to 48.70 cents a pound from 48.87 cents; Februay frozen pork bellies improved to 49.90 cents a pound from 49.77 cents. Gold and silver futures fell sharply on New York's Commodity Exchange. February gold dropped to $405.20 a troy ounce from $416.70; March silver plummeted to $5.273 a troy ounce from $5.654. Energy futures rose across the board on the New York Mercantile Exchange, gasoline for the fourth week, crude oil for the fifth and heating oil for the seventh week in a row. West Texas Intermediate crude oil for February delivery climbed to $21.82 a barrel from $21.29; January heating oil soared to $1.0187 a gallon from 81.74 cents; January unleaded gasoline climbed to 63.22 cents a gallon from 55.45 cents.
